thread.title: Charles Barkley doesn't shrink from LeBron James' rant, says 'whiny' comment correct
thread.title_full: Charles Barkley doesn't shrink from LeBron James' rant, says 'whiny' comment correct

author: Tom Gatto (tgatto@sportingnews.com)
title: Charles Barkley doesn't shrink from LeBron James' rant, says 'whiny' comment correct
text:
January 31, 2017 7:36pm   7:36pm EST The NBA on TNT analyst even gave King James props for Googling Barkley's history. Charles Barkley (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:36  36 p.m. ET 
Charles Barkley says he's not intimidated by LeBron James, so the things James said about Barkley on Monday night won't do anything to keep him quiet. Barkley was so unmoved, he even gave the Cavaliers star props for looking up his history of unsavory off-court behavior. 
Barkley's measured response Tuesday was a stark contrast to James' exasperation over Barkley calling James "whiny" last week because James went public seeking roster upgrades. 
MORE: Wade defends pal Bron by bashing Barkley 
"I stick by what I said, I'm not going to make this personal ... he was all whiny last week," Barkley told ESPN Radio . "I'm good and I'm straightforward, I'm never going to get personal on an NBA player." 
James ticked off a well-known laundry list of notorious things Barkley did or said during his playing days, including the famed "I am not a role model" quote. James was trying to contrast Barkley's character with his own; James said he has not had any such issues in his career. 
MORE: How NBA world reacted to James' comments 
Barkley said he was amused by James doing "some homework" and Googling Chuck's history. 
"Some of the stuff he said about me is correct â€” (it) doesn't make the message I said about him incorrect," Barkley said. "Some of them are intimidated about LeBron [but] I'm not intimidated at all." 
Barkley can repeat and/or expand on that response Thursday if he's in the studio for TNT's "Inside the NBA." Watch This
